meanings.sent1: The hill had a stee that made it hard to climb.
meanings.sent2: The hikers struggled to reach the top of the stee.
meanings.sent3: The children enjoyed sliding down the stee on their sleds.
meanings.sent4: The stee of the mountain seemed to touch the sky.
meanings.sent5: The stee of the roller coaster made my stomach drop.

meanings.definition: To climb or ascend with difficulty.
meanings.sent1: She had to stee up the rocky path carefully.
meanings.sent2: The mountaineers decided to stee the challenging peak.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to stee up the tree but kept slipping.
meanings.sent4: He had to stee over the fallen logs to reach the campsite.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to stee over the hurdles to win the race.

meanings.definition: To tilt or lean to one side.
meanings.sent1: The tower started to stee in the strong wind.
meanings.sent2: The boat began to stee as the waves grew larger.
meanings.sent3: The leaning tower seemed to stee even more after the earthquake.
meanings.sent4: The old fence continued to stee over time.
meanings.sent5: The treehouse started to stee to one side after the storm.
